1.text: And the whole earth was of one language and of one speech.

2.text: And it came to pass, as they journeyed east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar; and they dwelt there.

3.text: And they said one to another, Go to, let us make brick, and burn them throughly. And they had brick for stone, and slime had they for mortar.

4.text: And they said, Go to, let us build us a city, and a tower, whose top may reach unto heaven, and let us make us a name; lest we be scattered abroad upon the face of the whole earth.

5.text: And the LORD came down to see the city and the tower, which the children of men builded.

6.text: And the LORD said, Behold, they are one people, and they have all one language; and this is what they begin to do: and now nothing will be withholden from them, which they purpose to do.

7.text: Go to, let us go down, and there confound their language, that they may not understand one another’s speech.

8.text: So the LORD scattered them abroad from thence upon the face of all the earth: and they left off to build the city.

9.text: Therefore was the name of it called Babel; because the LORD did there confound the language of all the earth: and from thence did the LORD scatter them abroad upon the face of all the earth.

10.text: These are the generations of Shem. Shem was an hundred years old, and begat Arpachshad two years after the flood:

11.text: and Shem lived after he begat Arpachshad five hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

12.text: And Arpachshad lived five and thirty years, and begat Shelah:

13.text: and Arpachshad lived after he begat Shelah four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

14.text: And Shelah lived thirty years, and begat Eber:

15.text: and Shelah lived after he begat Eber four hundred and three years, and begat sons and daughters.

16.text: And Eber lived four and thirty years, and begat Peleg:

17.text: and Eber lived after he begat Peleg four hundred and thirty years, and begat sons and daughters.

18.text: And Peleg lived thirty years, and begat Reu:

19.text: and Peleg lived after he begat Reu two hundred and nine years, and begat sons and daughters.

20.text: And Reu lived two and thirty years, and begat Serug:

21.text: and Reu lived after he begat Serug two hundred and seven years, and begat sons and daughters.

22.text: And Serug lived thirty years, and begat Nahor:

23.text: and Serug lived after he begat Nahor two hundred years, and begat sons and daughters.

24.text: And Nahor lived nine and twenty years, and begat Terah:

25.text: and Nahor lived after he begat Terah an hundred and nineteen years, and begat sons and daughters.

26.text: And Terah lived seventy years, and begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran.

27.text: Now these are the generations of Terah. Terah begat Abram, Nahor, and Haran; and Haran begat Lot.

28.text: And Haran died in the presence of his father Terah in the land of his nativity, in Ur of the Chaldees.

29.text: And Abram and Nahor took them wives: the name of Abram’s wife was Sarai; and the name of Nahor’s wife, Milcah, the daughter of Haran, the father of Milcah, and the father of Iscah.

30.text: And Sarai was barren; she had no child.

31.text: And Terah took Abram his son, and Lot the son of Haran, his son’s son, and Sarai his daughter in law, his son Abram’s wife; and they went forth with them from Ur of the Chaldees, to go into the land of Canaan; and they came unto Haran, and dwelt there.

32.text: And the days of Terah were two hundred and five years: and Terah died in Haran.
